file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 23-81-01-04 - RADIO MANAGEMENT UNIT - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL RADIO MANAGEMENT UNIT - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the Radio Management Unit. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 23-81-01-000-801-A RADIO MANAGEMENT UNIT - REMOVAL RADIO MANAGEMENT UNIT - INSTALLA- ALL 23-81-01-400-801-A TION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 23-81-01 Page 1 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 23-81-01-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. RADIO MANAGEMENT UNIT - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the Radio Management Unit. B. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 223 Cockpit - LH side 224 Cockpit - RH side C. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable D. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable E. Consumable Materials Not Applicable F. Expandable Parts Not Applicable G. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task In the cockpit H. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open the RMU 1 and RMU 2 circuit breakers and attach a DO-NOT-CLOSE tag to them. I. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Release the two dzus fasteners (1). (2) Carefully pull the Radio Management Unit (2). (3) Disconnect the electrical connector (3). (4) Remove the Radio Management Unit (2). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 23-81-01 Page 2 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Radio Management Unit - Removal/Installation Figure 401 1 2 A A 2. RADIO MANAGEMENT UNIT 1. DZUS (2) 3. ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR DET. A 1 AIRCRAFT WITH RMU INSTALLED ON CONTROL PEDESTAL 2 AIRCRAFT WITH RMU INSTALLED ON MAIN INSTRUMENT PANEL 145AMM230126.MCE B EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 23-81-01 Page 3 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details. TUNE TUNE SQ DIM 1 2 STO SQ DIM 1 2 STO ID PGE TST DME ID PGE TST DME

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 23-81-01-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. RADIO MANAGEMENT UNIT - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the Radio Management Unit. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM SDS 23-81-00/1 RADIO MANAGEMENT SYSTEM - OPERATIONAL AMM TASK 23-81-00-700-801-A/500 TEST TASK 23-81-01-212-801-A - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 223 Cockpit - LH side 224 Cockpit - RH side D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task In the cockpit I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Connect the electrical connector (3). (2) Put the Radio Management Unit (2) in its installation position. (3) Attach the two dzus fasteners (1). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 23-81-01 Page 4 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, close the RMU 1 and RMU 2 circuit breakers and remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag from them. (2) Enter the RMU Setup page to verify if the parameters are in accordance with the airplane configuration and default operation (AMM SDS 23-81-00/1). If necessary configure them (TASK 23-81-01-212-801-A). (3) Do the Radio-Management-Unit operational test ( AMM TASK 23-81-00-700-801-A/ 500).
